snippet: Across Bosnia and Herzegovina, protesters are taking control of their future.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Croatian philosopher and author Srecko Horvat describes how protesters across Bosnia and Herzegovina are organizing plenums to create alternative governments by night, even as they occupy streets and public squares by day; contends that the situation shows that the people of the country are no longer interested in European Union or other outside intervention, and that they are struggling to create a better country for themselves.
lead_paragraph: Across Bosnia and Herzegovina, protesters are taking control of their future.
